author: @Quadratin_
title: Se maravillan turistas por la limpieza y belleza de Morelia
text:
Se maravillan turistas por la limpieza y belleza de Morelia
MORELIA, Mich., 26 de diciembre de 2024.- Ya pasada la Navidad, queda un periodo de dÃ­as antes del aÃ±o nuevo, espacio en el que muchas personas suelen tomar vacaciones. Salimos al centro de la ciudad de Morelia para preguntarle a los turistas cÃ³mo se los ha tratado la ciudad, y si han encontrado algo que pueda mejorar.
Pierre, quien visita la ciudad desde Europa, desde RumanÃ­a, manifiesta sentirse fascinado con lo poco que han conocido. Expresa que tienen escasa media hora en Morelia y les ha parecido una ciudad encantadora, le sorprende su limpieza y los jardines muy cuidados y coloridos. Cuenta que visitaron Morelia porque se han puesto la encomienda de visitar ciudades patrimonio.
Sobre la experiencia de llegar a Morelia, Andrea, quien es francesa, cuenta que llegaron este 26 por la noche y encontraron una ciudad muy viva y muy iluminada. Algo que le ha llamado mucho la atenciÃ³n es la decoraciÃ³n con luz de los jardines del centro histÃ³rico de Morelia, y las lÃ¡mparas colgantes de barro en algunos Ã¡rboles. Cuenta que han venido solo sabiendo que Morelia es ciudad patrimonio por la UNESCO, sin planear mÃ¡s.
Un caso curioso es que Andrea habla espaÃ±ol porque entre los aÃ±os 1993 y 1994 aprendiÃ³ este idioma a travÃ©s de la telenovela mexicana Rosa Salvaje, y eso le generÃ³ un deseo grande por visitar MÃ©xico.
La seÃ±ora Sara, quien visita Morelia desde Toluca, llegÃ³ hace unos dÃ­as con su familia. Cuenta que ya habÃ­a venido en otras ocasiones, pero habÃ­a sido de pasada, y ahora han tenido mÃ¡s tiempo para disfrutarla, "fuimos a Quiroga antier, ayer a PÃ¡tzcuaro, muy bonito".
Hasta ahora no ha visto algo que no le guste, "veo la ciudad muy limpia, las atenciones de los lugares a donde hemos ido, pues bastante agradables, muy cordiales las personas, mucha atenciÃ³n muy buena, considero que es un lugar bonito, la verdad sÃ­ me gusta mucho", asevera.
Al seÃ±or JosÃ© y su pareja los ha tratado muy bien la ciudad y el estado, "de maravilla", externa JosÃ©, quien es de Puerto Rico pero ya vive en Morelia y sale a pasear con su compaÃ±era y a disfrutar de la ciudad, todo estÃ¡ bien gracias a Dios, todo fluye bien", asegura.
Guillermina y su familia vinieron a Morelia por una boda, ellos son de Guadalajara, "la ciudad estÃ¡ hermosa de verdad, muy bonita y muy limpia", expresa. Es el primer dÃ­a de su estancia en Morelia, "prÃ¡cticamente tenemos horas y no nos hemos percatado de muchas cosas, de entrada se nos ha hecho muy hermosa", refiere.
En este viaje tienen ganas de ir a la regiÃ³n de Los Azufres, porque leyeron que es muy bonito, "a PÃ¡tzcuaro tambiÃ©n queremos ir, y tambiÃ©n leÃ­mos que estaba la isla de Janitzio, entonces tenemos la idea de ir a esos lugares porque vamos a durar cuatro dÃ­as".
Ignacio y su familia, quienes tambiÃ©n son de Guadalajara, estÃ¡n de vacaciones en la capital michoacana. Se sienten muy bien porque la ciudad estÃ¡ tranquila y estÃ¡ muy bonita, expone, "incluso ya vamos de salida, nomÃ¡s vinimos un ratito aquÃ­ de paseo para ya regresarnos a nuestra tierra", expresa y cuenta que la experiencia ha sido muy agradable, no han visto nada que los haya incomodado, y regresarÃ­an sin problema.

author: MarketScreener
title: Las familias de Sandy Hook quieren embargar cuentas de Alex Jones en redes sociales - MarketScreener
text:
Por Dietrich Knauth
NUEVA YORK, 13 jun (Reuters) - Las familias de las vÃ­ctimas de la masacre de Sandy Hook quieren embargar las cuentas de redes sociales de Alex Jones, diciendo que las frecuentes publicaciones del teÃ³rico de la conspiraciÃ³n a sus seguidores son una parte clave del negocio Infowars que estÃ¡ siendo liquidado para pagar las deudas de Jones.
Jones, que se declarÃ³ en quiebra hace 17 meses, ha renunciado a llegar a un acuerdo que reduzca los 1.500 millones de dÃ³lares que debe a los familiares de 20 estudiantes y seis miembros del personal que murieron en el tiroteo masivo de 2012 en la escuela primaria Sandy Hook en Newtown, Connecticut.
Jones y las familias de Sandy Hook estÃ¡n ahora de acuerdo en que los activos de Jones deben ser liquidados. Pero las familias pidieron el miÃ©rcoles a un juez de bancarrota de Houston, Texas, que ademÃ¡s tomara el control de la cuenta X.com de Jones e impidiera que Jones la utilizara para promover nuevos negocios.
Las familias de Sandy Hook pidieron al juez que dejara claro que la cuenta "@RealAlexJones" de Jones en X.com, antes conocida como Twitter, estarÃ¡ entre los activos entregados a un fideicomisario designado por el tribunal y encargado de liquidar los activos de Jones.
La cuenta X de Jones, que tiene 2,3 millones de seguidores, "no es diferente de una lista de clientes de cualquier otra empresa en liquidaciÃ³n", argumentaron las familias de Sandy Hook.
Sostuvieron que Jones ha utilizado la cuenta de redes sociales para hacer caer el valor de Infowars desviando las ventas de ese sitio a DrJonesNaturals.com de su padre, que vende suplementos para la salud y otros productos.
Jones fue expulsado de la plataforma durante casi cinco aÃ±os, pero su cuenta fue restablecida en diciembre tras una encuesta de usuarios realizada por Elon Musk, propietario de X.com.
EstÃ¡ previsto que un juez de quiebras de Estados Unidos atienda la demanda de las familias en una vista judicial que se celebrarÃ¡ el viernes en Houston.
Jones afirmÃ³ durante aÃ±os que la matanza de Sandy Hook fue un montaje con actores como parte de un complot del gobierno para confiscar las armas de los estadounidenses. Desde entonces, Jones ha reconocido que el tiroteo tuvo lugar.
El juez que supervisa la quiebra de Jones ha dictaminado que la mayor parte de la deuda sobrevivirÃ¡ tras una liquidaciÃ³n, porque fue el resultado de una conducta "deliberada y maliciosa".
Jones ha estimado que tiene menos de 12 millones de dÃ³lares en activos, lo que significa que arrastrarÃ¡ una enorme deuda legal incluso despuÃ©s de que Infowars y sus otros activos sean vendidos.
Las familias de Sandy Hook tienen la intenciÃ³n de continuar las acciones de cobro contra los futuros ingresos de Jones, y perseguir pagos adicionales de la esposa de Jones, el padre, los empleados y otros asociados a los que Jones supuestamente desviÃ³ activos.
Una liquidaciÃ³n conforme al CapÃ­tulo 7 permitirÃ¡ a las familias de Sandy Hook hacer cumplir sus sentencias "ahora y en el futuro, al tiempo que privarÃ¡ a Jones de la capacidad de infligir daÃ±os masivos como ha hecho durante unos 25 aÃ±os", dijo Chris Mattei, abogado de las familias de Sandy Hook.
(Reportaje de Dietrich Knauth; Editado en espaÃ±ol por Juana Casas)
Comparte Â© Reuters - 2024

author: Georgina Young
title: Xbox brings total layoffs to 2.5k following $69billion Call of Duty buyout
text:
Xbox brings total layoffs to 2.5k following $69billion Call of Duty buyout
XBOX has announced that another 650 people will lose their jobs following its $69billion purchase of publisher Activision Blizzard.
The Call of Duty publisher is one of the largest companies in the industry, and also owns blockbuster series such as World of Warcraft, Diablo, and Candy Crush.
However, the purchase has not been smooth for a large number of employees that are now under Xbox.
This round of layoffs follows the 1.9k job losses that followed the purchase early this year.
Microsoft gaming chief Phil Spencer circulated an internal email announcing that a further 650 people would be laid off in the games division.
Game File gained access to the email that Spencer sent employees informing them of the layoffs.
More in Xbox
In the last round of layoffs, top executives like Blizzard president Mike Ybarra left the company, but Spencer confirms that this round is focused on corporate and support roles.
He does emphasise that â€œno games, devices or experiences are being cancelled and no studios are being closedâ€ this time.
We know that in the previous wave of layoffs, at least one project at Blizzard was cancelled and four studios and their projects were shut down.
A few months ago, Microsoft increased the Xbox Game Pass prices to bring in more revenue, but the changes hadnâ€™t even been implemented fully before the job losses were announced.
Most read in Gaming
In the email Spencer says: â€œFor the past year, our goal has been to minimise disruption while welcoming new teams and enabling them to do their best work.
â€œAs part of aligning our post-acquisition team structure and managing our business, we have made the decision to eliminate approximately 650 roles across Microsoft Gamingâ€”mostly corporate and supporting functionsâ€”to organise our business for long term success.
â€œI know that this is difficult news to hear. We are deeply grateful for the contributions of our colleagues who are learning they are impacted
â€œSeparately, as part of running the business, there are some impacts to other teams as they adapt to shifting priorities and manage the lifecycle and performance of games.
â€œNo games, devices or experiences are being cancelled and no studios are being closed as part of these adjustments today.
â€œI know that going through more changes like this is hard, but even in the most trying times, this team has been able to come together and show one another care and kindness as we work to continue delivering for our players.
â€œWe appreciate your support as we navigate these changes and we thank you for your compassion and respect for each other.â€
If you want to read more about Xbox, check out how
Tony Hawk teased a new Pro Skater game.

author: éƒ­å‡¯
title: Booming recycling market benefits environment - Chinadaily.com.cn
text: From pre-loved clothing and handbags to furniture and books, the trade in secondhand merchandise is growing rapidly in China â€” delivering not only bargains, but also green benefits. The trend represents a change in Chinese people's mindset, as more consumers are recognizing the value of extending the life span of products through reuse and recycling. By embracing the secondhand market, they are not only finding cost-effective alternatives but also contributing to a more sustainable and eco-friendly way of life through the recycling of goods. Kang Lin, in her 40s, is originally from Shenzhen, Guangdong province, and now calls Hong Kong home. A seasoned traveler, she lived in Oxford, the United Kingdom, for a year and a half, Shanghai for a year, and Chiang Mai, northern Thailand, for 12 months. For Kang, buying secondhand goods is more than just a cost-saving measure â€” it's a lifestyle choice that celebrates sustainability and uncovers hidden treasures from the past. "When I lived overseas, buying secondhand was the most cost-effective option since these items were inexpensive, and I didn't mind discarding them when I left," she said. "It's also environmentally friendly, as it prevents usable items from going to waste â€” my unwanted items may be desired by others, and vice versa."

author: Enric Bonet
title: Condenan a 8 meses de prisiÃ³n a un anciano por amenazar de muerte a la jueza del caso Le Pen
text:
Secciones
Servicios
Empieza la respuesta judicial a la oleada de amenazas de la extrema derecha francesa contra los magistrados. El Tribunal de Bobigny (periferia norte de ParÃ­s) ... condenÃ³ este miÃ©rcoles por la tarde a ocho meses de prisiÃ³n condicional a un internauta, de 76 aÃ±os, que habÃ­a amenazado de muerte a la jueza que inhabilitÃ³ a Marine Le Pen hasta 2030. La pena para este jubilado, que no tenÃ­a antecedentes, incluye una multa de 3.000 euros.
Tras el anuncio del veredicto por el caso de los falsos asistentes en el Parlamento Europeo de la ultraderechista AgrupaciÃ³n Nacional (RN, por sus siglas en francÃ©s), GÃ©rard B. publicÃ³ en la red social X la fotografÃ­a de una guillotina, acompaÃ±ada por el mensaje Â«es lo que merece esta putaÂ». Lo escribiÃ³ refiriÃ©ndose a la jueza BÃ©nÃ©dicte de Perthuis, que presidiÃ³ la corte que declarÃ³ culpable a Le Pen de haber llevado a cabo Â«un sistemaÂ» que permitiÃ³ a su partido malversar 4,5 millones del Parlamento Europeo. AdemÃ¡s de una inhabilitaciÃ³n a efectos inmediatos de cinco aÃ±os, la lÃ­der de la extrema derecha fue condenada a cuatro aÃ±os de prisiÃ³n (dos ellos condicionales) y una multa de 100.000 euros.
El mensaje por parte de ese simpatizante de la derecha radical solo fue visto por 200 personas en la red social de Elon Musk. A pesar de ello, lo detuvieron y lo procesaron a travÃ©s de un juicio rÃ¡pido. Â«En Francia, hay personas a las que cortaron la cabezaÂ» tras haber sufrido una campaÃ±a de acoso en internet, ha recordado el fiscal. Lo ha dicho refiriÃ©ndose al caso del profesor Samuel Paty, asesinado en 2020 por un joven yihadista. Â«DetrÃ¡s de su telÃ©fono en su casa (â€¦), uno no asume ningÃºn riesgo. Pero eso puede ser un pretexto para personas violentas o con problemas mentalesÂ», ha aÃ±adido el representante del Ministerio PÃºblico.
El autor de esa amenaza de muerte es un francÃ©s 'pied-noir' que naciÃ³ en la Argelia francesa y se fue a la Francia metropolitana cuando tenÃ­a 14 aÃ±os, tras la independencia de ese paÃ­s. Actualmente, estÃ¡ jubilado tras haber dirigido una empresa de informÃ¡tica. Durante el juicio, se defendiÃ³ con que la foto de la guillotina Â«era un Â«sÃ­mbolo de justicia. Lo que querÃ­a decir es que algunos jueces quizÃ¡s merecerÃ­an ser juzgadosÂ». Tras la sentencia del 31 de marzo, se multiplicaron en internet los mensajes insultantes y amenazantes contra BÃ©nÃ©dicte de Perthuis. Hasta el punto de que tuvieron que desplegar una protecciÃ³n policial especÃ­fica para esta magistrada.

author: Jessica McSweeney
title: Central Coast Grammar student critically injured during excursion to Government House, Canberra
text: Add articles to your saved list and come back to them any time. A student has been critically injured while on a school excursion to the governor-generalâ€™s Canberra home when a tree branch fell on a group of children. The Central Coast Grammar School party was visiting Government House on Wednesday as part of a year 6 camp when a large tree branch fell on a small group of students just before 3pm. A child was critically injured by a falling tree branch at government house in Canberra. Credit: Alex Ellinghausen One student who was struck by the branch suffered significant injuries and was rushed to hospital in a critical condition. A spokesperson for the ACT Emergency Services Agency said two other children were treated at the scene for minor injuries but did not require hospital admissions. The school trip was cut short, and the group returned to the Central Coast on Thursday. In a message to parents on Thursday, school principal Phil Oâ€™Regan said the female student remained in hospital in a critical condition. â€œOur staff remain in contact with all year 6 families, offering the care and assistance of our counselling and wellbeing teams, and we extend our support to any other student requiring additional help,â€ the email said. â€œAs a close community with strong values, I ask that you keep [the student] and their family in your hearts. Also, that you keep a watchful eye on your child and ask for help if they are struggling to cope with what has occurred.â€ Central Coast Grammar is an independent K-12 school based in Erina, 350 kilometres from Canberra. Get the dayâ€™s breaking news, entertainment ideas and a long read to enjoy. Sign up to receive our Evening Edition newsletter.

author: Cheryl A. Cuddahy
title: Christopher Daley to present 'The History of Emancipation and Juneteenth' - Sentinel and Enterprise
text:
LANCASTER â€” Christopher Daley has been captivating audiences across New England for over 30 years with engaging presentations on historical topics. Over the past three years, he has expanded his reach nationally, delivering virtual lectures via Zoom to audiences throughout the United States. His talks have been featured at libraries, historical societies, schools, and various clubs and organizations.
Daley is excited to present â€œThe History of Emancipation and Juneteenthâ€ from 7 until 8:30 p.m. Tuesday, June 17, at the Thayer Memorial Library, 717 Main St., and the community is welcome.
â€œâ€™The History of Emancipation & Juneteenthâ€™ is a 60-minute slide presentation which begins with a short history of the Abolitionist movement from the 1830s through the Civil War,â€ explained Daley.
The discussion will then turn to all the causes of the Civil War and the growing hue and cry for the end of slavery.
Additionally, the election of Abraham Lincoln will be examined spotlighting his views on slavery and African Americans. Through the course of the talk, you will also see a revealing view on how his ideas and opinions evolved over time.
â€œThe second part of the presentation we will look at some of the events that led up to The Emancipation Proclamation,â€ Daley said. â€œSuch as Freemontâ€™s Emancipation, Hunterâ€™s Emancipation, and General Benjamin Butlerâ€™s orders on â€˜Contraband of Warâ€™.â€
Then, it will turn to the Emancipation Proclamation itself; the timing of it, the politics of it, and who was actually freed by it.
The third part of the presentation will focus on the gradual emancipation of slaves by Federal Troops as they conquered the different Confederate states, the end of the war, the movement of troops into Texas, and the famous issuing of General Order No. 3 on June 19, 1865, at Galveston, Texas, and how the news spread through Texas and the reaction of the slaves to tidings of freedom.
â€œThe final part of the talk will showcase how Juneteenth went from a local Galveston celebration to a national holiday,â€ Daley added.
Daley holds both a B.A. and an M.A. in Political Science and History from Bridgewater State University. He has held several notable positions in the field of history, including serving as President of the Pembroke Historical Society and Chairman of the Pembroke Historical Commission.
Additionally, he worked as a docent and Coordinator of Educational Outreach at the John Alden House Historic Site. After a 25-year career teaching history at the Silver Lake Regional School System in Kingston, Daley recently retired to focus on his historical endeavors.
As a writer, Daley has contributed numerous articles on diverse historical topics to local publications and authored the book â€œMurder and Mayhem in Boston: Historic Crimes in the Hubâ€.
His expertise has also been sought for television, including serving as a historical consultant on the Sacco-Vanzetti case for the Travel Channelâ€™s Time Traveling with Brian Unger and appearing as a historian in two episodes of Kindred Spirits focusing on the Lizzie Borden case.
â€œI enjoy giving these presentations because it allows me to share topics Iâ€™m passionate about with others who share my interests,â€ Daley said.
This program is suitable for ages 10 and up. For more information, or to register, please visit thayermemoriallibrary.org.

author: PTI
title: Amit Shah Hails Somnath Temple Symbol of Sanatan Pride Amidst Welfare Prayers | Entertainment
text: Amit Shah Hails Somnath Temple Symbol of Sanatan Pride Amidst Welfare Prayers Union Home Minister Amit Shah praised Lord Somnath as a symbol of eternal Sanatan culture during his visit to the jyotirlinga temple in Gujarat. Shah performed rituals and wished for prosperity. He also addressed public health issues following a fire at TRP Game Zone and cholera outbreak in Gandhinagar. [PTI](/pti-stories)| Ahmedabad | Updated: 01-06-2024 17:01 IST | Created: 01-06-2024 17:01 IST - Country: - India Union Home Minister Amit Shah on Saturday emphasized that Lord Somnath stands as a beacon of pride within the indelible Sanatan culture. Shah offered prayers for prosperity at the jyotirlinga temple in Gujarat, underscoring the enduring significance of Somnath. As a trustee of the Shree Somnath Trust, Shah performed 'dhwaj puja' and noted that long-standing rituals continue to inspire perseverance despite struggles. In a social media post, Shah expressed his wishes for India's welfare after his visit. Additionally, Shah reviewed actions at Rajkot International Airport related to last week's TRP Game Zone fire and instructed local officials on measures to control a cholera outbreak in Gandhinagar. (This story has not been edited by Devdiscourse staff and is auto-generated from a syndicated feed.)
